website_summaries.verdict: A little smaller and less expensive than some other cable pullers, but it delivers a surprising level of control.
pros: The unit’s braided steel cable has a build quality that outperforms more expensive models
Uses steel throughout the construction for long lasting performance
Resists rust with a galvanized finish
Great value for a 2-ton cable puller
cons: Hand grip on the handle is small
Safe working load is only 1 ton

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but very low scale.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for pulling very small (two inch or less) stumps from the ground. Was using in tandem with sets of towing straps wrapped about other trees, with their total load capacity well below the full two-ton rating of this device. After multiple uses, the two main bushings had severe damage to their bearing surfaces, and the weld joining the spool together failed. If this product is rated for even 1 ton of regular use, I received one that was defective, because multiple internal parts failed with light use.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.M.

customer_reviews.title: Awful Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. Broke the first time I used it. I was using it to pull welded wire fence with a couple of tow straps. On the second pull once under moderate tension the release button was so tight it could not be depressed by hand. I attempted to use pliers to push it, but the cheap metal tab bent before it disengaged. I had to bypass it with a screwdriver to directly disengage it. On the third pull part of the metal wire slipped into the gearing and froze the whole darn thing permanently. Absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the TEKTON 5541 2-Ton Power Puller and it was 3 months before I needed to use it. After following all the steps in the manual it was impossible to release the cable so it could be used. I finally found the answer in one of the Amazon Reviews of the product by Kent (Extremely frustrating) but this will only works when you have 2 strong men and a steady tree. My 30 days warranty had elapsed so I could not return it. Don’t waste your money on this
customer_reviews.author: P. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: I had to return the product twice. The cord ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the product twice. The cord wouldn't move in or out. It might be user error, but it shouldn't be that difficult to use. Amazon did right by me and refunded both purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: A little stiff trying to use, and trying to keep the cable tracking is a pain, but for the price it works well. If you are going to use one a lot, you will likely want to get something of better quality, but for the occasional job (I used it to pull trees away from my house, as I downed them) it will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Poor design = infuriating to use
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing quality. Returned. The cable jammed in the pulley, requiring field disassembly of the pulley to free the cable (injuring my hand in the process). The active “pawl” which ratchets the cable tighter is extremely difficult to reposition from the tighten to the loosen position, and the “hold” pawl is also difficult to move. The safety devices on the hooks are flimsy— I was lucky not to break one when I unhooked the tow strap. The hooks are to small to easily accommodate a tow strap. If you intend to use with a tow strap, you should have a heavy-duty carabiner to connect the hook(s) to the tow strap(s).
customer_reviews.author: Imagenes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for this price point
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, it cannot be beat. I had a medium size tree that leaned heavily onto my neighbor's property after a heavy winter storm. I purchased this and used it to pull it back upright and stake it in the proper position. It was easy to use and functioned perfectly. I can not comment on heavy use but for a medium-size job, I am completely happy with this product. I will use it to straighten fence posts that have moved and leaned over time.
customer_reviews.author: SpeedySpy

customer_reviews.title: This product is defective - AND THE COMPANY KNOWS ABOUT IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: this product is defective - the cable is jammed inside its housing - AND THE COMPANY KNOWS ABOUT IT!!! I called Tekton support because even when you put the locking spring in the "up" position to release the lever that locks into the gear teeth to hold the cable in position - the cable itself is wound so tightly that it's still stuck in the housing! And the worst part is - Tekton told me that they KNOW about this problem, & discontinued this product several years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Chris JungTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Never felt safe trying to move something that was well within its maximum capacity. Constantly jammed pieces bent and could release ratchet when we were finally finished with the ratchet. Constantly binding and metal crimp holding cable together started to deform. Glad I saw that before it snapped on me. See pictures. Probably ok for really light work.
customer_reviews.author: DC Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Gunk for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Took me 2 hours to get the cable out. This may be useful, but only if you are going to pull something 7’ plus or minus away.. I wanted to use it to pull in the swing arm in on a motorcycle I was building. I needed it to move the swing arm 3/16 “. As i cranked it in, the cable just buried itself in the rewind and the rest of the cable. Sure didn’t budge the swing arm. 2 more hours to get the cable out and wind it up according to the direction number six. If it weren’t for this virus issue,I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: Biggest piece of crap EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small job I purchased this to complete. It should be a 15 minute job. I still cant get the spool unwound after messing with it for well over an hour. I just wasted a full weekend because this was the first thing I needed to use and this piece of crap wont work. So this 15 minute job will complete me from doing a weekends worth of work.
customer_reviews.author: Riverrat

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper at Harbor Freight looks the same to me
customer_reviews.text: It's cheaply made. Mine had a thin metal Cable Guide that failed immediately. I had to build and install a decent one. I saw one that looks exactly the same for cheaper at Horrible Frieght. It's an OK tool kinda like that boring date you never talk about. At 15 bucks it would be a bargain. It's like the picture of a hamburger on the menu which barely resembles what's on the plate. It gets me by but the quality just ain't there.
customer_reviews.author: Theysaid

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: According to the instructions, you have to push down on the release lever AND pull up on the pawl AND have someone else pull out the cable. It takes two people to pull out the cable to use this tool. We've only used it three times and the third time the wire cable got stuck on the side of the metal guide. We couldn't pry it out with a screwdriver. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: amazed

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: The instructions state that when both prawls are released the wheel spins freely. That is not the case. I had to grab the cable with a locking pliers and pull very hard to get the cable out. The cable gets jammed in the wheel and locks everything up. It was like this out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: L. LaBarbera

customer_reviews.title: I just works
customer_reviews.text: Works easily and correctly. While it is clearly marked not to be used to lift things, I was able to use it to carefully lift a large A/C outside unit, brace it in place then replace its rotting platform and lower the unit back into position. The latches worked easily. The only minor problem was the spring to shift from lift to release was a little tight for the first few activations. Otherwise it just worked. I would purchase it again if I need such a device.
customer_reviews.author: J. Segers

customer_reviews.title: Better to have more so I could use this on ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to tension my chain link fence. I opted for the 4 ton over the 2 ton because I felt 'why not? Better to have more so I could use this on a different, heavier, application'. But this bad boy is quite heavy. I'm not sure if the 2 ton would have been lighter but when your trying to tension a fence that probably only needs a couple hundred pounds at most, the weight becomes a nuisance to set on your terminal posts. I am completely happy with my purchase. Although, until I use it for an application which requires a 4 ton capacity, I'll probably recommend getting the 2 ton puller.
customer_reviews.author: Unerware

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit of over kill for pullers but when you need some serious force to move something this is the one. I use it to pull trees over. This leaves a hole in the ground which is better than a stump. Works well with 3/8 inch grade 70 log chain.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse E. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: I needed to use needle nose pliers just to operate it.
customer_reviews.text: Just look at the piece of plastic that covers the spring that is supposed to lock and unlock the handle. I need to winch four leland cypress upright and I doubt of this spring/switch/plasti thing will withstand even that little bit of work. And it is a pain to switch to either position. This should be allowed to be sold thru any outlet in this country.
customer_reviews.author: lon crow

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YHOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: GOT THIS AND LOOKED GREAT OUT OF BOX, BUT THAN WHEN I WENT TO LOOSEN COIL I COUND IT WAS JAM,ED TOGETHER . I TRIED TO HOOK ONE END TO POST AND ATTACH ANOTHER TO BACK OF LAWN MOWER. ONE PERSON HELPED AND WE STILL SOULD NOT LOOSEN IT WHEN RELEASING THE LATCH, SO USELESS, IF THE BOX HAD BOT BEEN THROWN AWAAY I WOULD HAVE SENT IT BACK...TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED,
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Do NOT Buy! Deserves a Zero Start rating!
customer_reviews.text: Listen to the other reviews! Do not buy. This is junk! Out of the box, I could not pull out the cable off the reel more than a foot. The reel jammed tight and would not let any more cable off the reel. Yes, all the springs/gears were properly set to allow the cable to free wheel. I even tried excessive force. JUNK!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Flame Red

customer_reviews.title: Great to have when you need to move something big!
customer_reviews.text: This come-along worked really great! I pulled a large black walnut log onto my trailer (s l o w l y) with it and I could not have done it without the come-along. I keep the come-along in my van for emergencies and occasional use when I have the trailer and need to drag something onto the trailer. Great to have when needed!
customer_reviews.author: Rufus

customer_reviews.title: Works for light jobs
customer_reviews.text: I used this to pull 4" to 8" trees down away from my house/fence. It's pretty easy to use, I did need to ratchet out several times, and that was fairly easy. I recommend work gloves. It did what I bought it for perfectly, but I would not use this for off-road car/truck recovery. It lists it's maximum safe working load at 2000lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Elder

customer_reviews.title: Garbage don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Used one time now 1 day past return window and it’s broken. This is pure garbage don’t waste your money or time buying one. Hopefully this will keep others from wasting their money. Amazon drop this supplier and please do a better job on reviewing and deciding what to offer .
customer_reviews.author: pjammie

customer_reviews.title: Really liked this one.
customer_reviews.text: Had a metal carport crush from snow load and was essentially resting on my boat. I staked the base down and used this puller attached to a tree and the side of the carport to pull it sideways enough to clear and remove the undamaged boat. Was surprised how strong and easy this was and the length (7') of the cable pull. Now that I have one I realize how many other jobs it will be great for. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Trash.
customer_reviews.text: Broke with first use. Wouldn’t recommend. Pulled out my fathers from 1980 and worked and held up perfect.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. Difficult to disconnect. One of the hook clips broke after first use. I would be willing to spend the extra money on a sturdier product. Not for heavy duty jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Country1

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, you can't use it by yourself.
customer_reviews.text: It's one of the cheapest options and that's why I give it an extra star. Here is why it deserves only 1: read other reviews pointing to the same problem. It has those weird black cable guards that jam the cable, so it is freaking impossible to unspool. The first time I had to fully take it apart to unjam the cable. Now every time I have to wedge a tool in between cable and cable guards while someone else is pulling on the cable. Don't buy it as you likely won't be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Asharat Mendikulov

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to pull a fence tight. I wish I would have paid closer attention to the cable length though. Mine were only like 6’. I needed about 14’!!! However they pulled excellent. I just added some chains to extend my pull distance. Worked great and my fence is tight!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Wisenbaker

customer_reviews.title: Double hooked come-alongs don't have much working distance but they ...
customer_reviews.text: Double hooked come-alongs don't have much working distance but they definitely do the job. I prefer working with block and tackle and heavy line but I had to resort to this with a chain set-up made for heavy steel pipe. That widow maker is fire wood now thanks to this handy do-hicky. It helps if you already have straps, shackles, chains and a tree or stump [not cut short] strategically placed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but alittle hard to get started
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to pull out several tree stumps. Is very hard to pull out hook at first as cable kinks when it's all in. Had to bend the guard out and pry out the cable with a big screw driver first before it could be used. Once you can get the able out though it works great
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: High-tension steel cable spooling spring is poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: High-tension cable spooling spring is poorly designed, so it binds with the racket gears, which makes it impossible to release the steel cable by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rugged but was jammed.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it heavily yet, but it looks very rugged. No 5th star since it was very difficult to get the cable unwound to test it. It would release to about three feet, then it would go no further. I used light oil, hooked it and pulled and retracted several times before I could get it loose. It is working better now but will edit this review if the problem shows again under regular use.
customer_reviews.author: David Rand

customer_reviews.title: Power when Needed
customer_reviews.text: Pulling heavy loads not a problem with the right tools. Needed to re-arrange some tree limbs and this come-along provided the muscle. Changing the tree limb direction saved cutting it off or down. Easy to use and glad to have it handy for the next muscle job.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Siegel

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this puller where the winch on my tractor causes the tractor to slide. It works better than I expected for the price. I would modify the pawls on the ratchet to make them easier to release. A more expensive come-a-long would work more smoothly. If you only use a come-a-long on rare occasions, this one is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Twitchell, PhD Voc Ed

customer_reviews.title: Bad reviews come from improper use
customer_reviews.text: I think a lot of these bad reviews simply come from people not knowing how to use the product. Ive used two of these to tie several cars down on my trailer and they have worked just fine. No binding, they are not hard to release, and they hold the load just fine. They held a car down on an 8 hour trip both ways, and still work great. As a disclaimer, these are not exactly designed for what I use them for, but they work well, and my use is a testament to if you just learn how to operate them properly, they don't give you any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Blair

customer_reviews.title: Good timing
customer_reviews.text: Had a project pulling stumps, was using my trusty 30 year old 2 ton. Saw this on Amazon and decided, why not... Next day the cable snapped on my 2 ton, within a week this arrived and I was able to safely complete my project...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Romero

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Almost 5 star. Only problem I had was the cable sliding off the cable and getting jammed. I was able to take it apart and while I was at it I added a shim to each side so so the pulley couldn’t easily move from side to side. No problem after that.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: Item shipped had obviously been damaged and returned previously. I only discovered this today when I finally got around to opening the package. The cable will not unwind from the damaged spool. All this after a months-long delay from order date to shipping. And now past refund period? Terrible/non-existent customer service. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: R. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Worked really good, until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: The handle failed, which is better than the unit failing during load, but it's still garbage now. I won't be getting another. I really doubt I hit the 4000lb max load.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Suderman

customer_reviews.title: Strength, that it is easy to use and durability
customer_reviews.text: It’s my second power puller. I was able to change the wire for a thinner one since I need it for smaller (less than one ton) job but did not make the difference. It did the job in an excellent manner.
customer_reviews.author: Mercadossa

customer_reviews.title: zipline review a+
customer_reviews.text: Used it to tension my zipline, de-tensioning is a bit of a pain but its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I got this to pull logs through the woods and also use to uproot smaller trees. I have done my best to try to break it but it is still functional. Overall quality is acceptable, it will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive tool it works quite well and is good quality. A bit cumbersome to release the tension but I’d have to say it ensures the safe release of the tension. I completed the job and it did well
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Morrell

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: I used this all of 1 time. It broke the very first t time I tried to ket the slack out. Total garbage
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Used to crank up dock to add floats beneath.
customer_reviews.author: Dan W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this while building fence with high tensile barbed wire. It is a beast! Don't know how we would have gotten the job done without it. Even my father - who has been farming for nearly 50 years - was impressed with the performance of this puller. To make things even better, the Amazon price beat other sources by a country mile. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Came in very handy for pulling heavy furniture up the stairs out of the house. Wouldn't have been able to do it otherwise. Cable came off the pulley first time using it but just kept an eye on it afterwards. Caught it in time not to do damage to cable. Once you get used to levers to crank and release it's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: luis gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great for pulling bushes
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to pull some bushes out of my yard and while it is a lot of work it worked great. Much easier than using a shovel. It is very well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: and it worked great. Seems of fine quality
customer_reviews.text: I used it once, and it worked great. Seems of fine quality. I bought it on a lark, figuring it would be handy to have around, and a pain and delay to buy one when suddenly needed. 3 days after I received it, naturally an emergency arose. Worked great. Pulled a 600 lb cast iron boat keel across a driveway like nothing.
customer_reviews.author: C22

customer_reviews.title: Tekton 6642 2-Ton Power Puller
customer_reviews.text: 2-Ton Power Puller works pretty good but it takes two people to release the cable when you first get it.One to push in the to release and the other to pull out the cable.Once you get that done it works as expected a few ratcheting and it pulled my S-10 Chevy Blazer out of a pretty good sized hole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look like it would hold up to heavy
customer_reviews.text: Pulled my (very stuck) garden tractor out of the mud. Paid for itself after that one use. Doesn't look like it would hold up to heavy, daily use but it will absolutely get you out of the occasional jam.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Smith

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It was a little challenge to release the device. I had to go into my super sayain mode, but I got it done. I used a little oil on the releasing things to make it easier to unlatch.
customer_reviews.author: Might Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worked but clunky
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's strong and high quality, but the ergonomics and ease of use could be better. To release the gear and let out some slack it's a little spring on a kind of sharp piece of metal and the gear release lever is small and slippery. It worked pretty well but it was a pain to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Radloff

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for pulling a car onto a trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to wench a 92 5.0 Mustang (4200 pounds) onto a trailer. The mustang had a flat tire that I could not air up as well. This come a long pulled it no problem. I did end up using 2 of them in tandem so I could detach one while the other held the car in place, and back and forth. Etc etc. Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Slug Jones

customer_reviews.title: Tool bent during first use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use this tool until 4 months after I bought it. This tool bent and has become really hard to use. The steel ratchet handle doesn't slide over the metal disks that house the cable. If I would have used this closer to the date I bought it, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Buy another product
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy. Rated at 4000lb. Used once and it didn’t perform. Reel mechanism bound up and didn’t turn. Put it in the garbage today
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, nothing fancy.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, nothing special. Put up a large perimeter fence using this as a stretcher.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Theeke

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to test it, mine had issues
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to test the function before you need it. I pulled it out of the box and it would not work, there is a black metal housing that was bent and prevented the main spool drive latch catch from moving. I had to bend it to get it to work. Had i been in the field i may not have had a tool to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff for my over 65 fingers to release.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, draws together drawers that were too heavy for me, but the metal release lever is way to stiff for my hands. Ratchet release slider is ok but spring line clamp one was impossible for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Would have liked the steel cable to be longer but not a real issue. Good value for the price and well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Van Cook

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time in use, not easy to use either
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of these over the years and this one was the worse by far. To even get it to spool cable you risk fingers. Amazon, I wouldn't carry as at the end of the day, it reflects on you.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bates

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably-priced and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My husband checked the price of renting a "come along" for a big yard project, and ended up buying this instead. It was perfect for the job of moving large, heavy logs into place.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I paid
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to get into modes. Had to use screwdriver to free up binding cable. I use it to pull bushes and small trees out.
customer_reviews.author: jsumr110

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They did the job. Pulling a leaning tree back up to vertical. My only problem. Using the release trigger..
customer_reviews.author: Bill Nickloff

customer_reviews.title: Great price but poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good price poor quality. The cable keeps jumping off the pulley in getting hung up in the middle of jobs. I have had take the pulley off and put it back on track. Very aggrevating.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more
customer_reviews.text: The lever to switch gear direction bent every time I used it. I was worried it was going to snap of eventually. By a better quality unit
customer_reviews.author: jake james

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: Went to use it for the first time, and the cable wouldnt spool out as after following the instructions. I had to pry the black cable guide to let the cable out. Would return subpar product if I could, but waited to long before I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Zach McKeown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Great manual puller with plenty of power. It was easy to use, and the directions were simple and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and its a bargain for the quality. I believe this is the lowest price for this on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: mike g.

customer_reviews.title: Pulling a mower onto a trailer
customer_reviews.text: The pulley helped me pull a Zero radius 60 inch mower onto a trailer, The safety features were a little pulzzeling until I got used to them.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis of Derby

customer_reviews.title: Expectations Met
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a power puller to do some tree work in my yard. Did not want to drop a bunch of cash. This puller was reasonably priced. I read some reviews that had me concerned, such that the HW was not strong enough and would bend or break. I used the puller per spec and it worked out great. Hanging in my tool shed now waiting for the next job...
customer_reviews.author: JHH

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. Very strong and durable. It is very user friendly and I only really needed the instructions when I had it holding a heavy load and needed to loosen it. I do wish it came with some smaller latch hooks as attachments for when you need to use this to hook through something smaller and not as heavy. I had to find a smaller metal hook to hook the piece I was lifting and then hook it onto this puller since the j hook was too large to fit in the item.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Used this to pull chain link fence fabric. It really worked well and made it easy to finish my fence.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Paul Lauzon

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: used it to pull wire fencing worked great. used it to try to uproot a fence post, post broke.
customer_reviews.author: c.l.

customer_reviews.title: it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to pull up several small trees that were down from a storm. it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A LITTLE STIFF AT FIRST
customer_reviews.text: Took some time to get it to release first time used but turned out fine in the end.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Straightening a tree
customer_reviews.text: It is doing a good job straightening a tree that was leaning towards our house. I tighten it a little each day and it may take a year to get it where I want.
customer_reviews.author: charles seider

customer_reviews.title: Great product and will continue to buy more TEKTON tools.
customer_reviews.text: Just used it two days ago while cutting a tree and it performed great! Becoming a true believer of TEKTON tools for their durability, ease of use and ergonomic design.
customer_reviews.author: George H. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well several upgrades since the last time I ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well several upgrades since the last time I used one. It now has Cable Guide and Guard as well as pulley wheel t line end to keep from binding and make even pull. thanks I would definitely buy another if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Spring guide was crooked
customer_reviews.text: The one I received had already been opened and returned before. The metal spring lake guide was crooked and hung on the ratchet wheel when trying to loosen the cable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure whether this power puller would straighten some steel fence fence posts embedded in a concrete wall that had been bent from flood waters. I hooked a chain around a nearby oak tree and proceeded to bend every steelpost back to vertical almost effortlessly. This is really a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Hare

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Did about 10 pulls with under 500 lbs. handle bent, unit tweeked. Junk
customer_reviews.author: dubewa

customer_reviews.title: Read Drirection for Cable Release
customer_reviews.text: Good Coma Long. Not a toy. Had problem understanding the release system. Price is Good,
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: worked but was sketchy
customer_reviews.text: use caution at every movement, felt unsafe and springs were not easy to adjust in use
customer_reviews.author: Brice

customer_reviews.title: Works but release is a Hazzard
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. My only issue is the release is very difficult and potentially dangerous. I would give it five stars if they Incorporated a safer release button as opposed to the very manual and finger pinching set up they have now
customer_reviews.author: mason

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hand winch
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for light pull jobs. It is not heavy duty, so don't abuse it. I recommend before the first use to unwind completely and rewind cable.
customer_reviews.author: alexei

customer_reviews.title: Just...No
customer_reviews.text: Just NO. Thrown in the barn in the pile of regret purchases
customer_reviews.author: Nora McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly and easily.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to straighten my mail box which had been knocked over by a garbage truck. One strap to a tree, one to the mail box pole, and when meeting in the middle at the puller, a few cranks. No sweat, very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Ann

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be very good quality, everything is tight as it should be
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very good quality, everything is tight as it should be. Luckily have not had to use it to pull my truck out of anything, but compared to others brands that I have had over the years, I am confident this will get the job done if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous CT Boomer

customer_reviews.title: A must tool!
customer_reviews.text: One tool you need when you have no help! Strong and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: M L G

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Actually worked! It won't provide decades of use, but it will do in a pinch or two
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure how to rate this:
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived wet, when opened a spring fell out. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Rupp

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my truck lol
customer_reviews.text: My truck was stuck in the mud and I tried pulling it out turned out not to be what I needed but a good reason to buy a new too lol
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hill

customer_reviews.title: One and done.
customer_reviews.text: It pulled one 50 pound log seven ft then in jammed and (short of buying another come-along to try and fix it) no amount of effort will get it to un-spool. It was really stiff and the switch you have to hold down to un-spool it (the one time it worked) seems like a busted knuckle waiting to happen. It's going back in the box and a back to the vender.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T Coursey

customer_reviews.title: Stuck
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to pull past a point. It has been stuck making it impossible to stretch past 1 foot since I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Jr

customer_reviews.title: Move stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellently for moving my hot tub. The unlock spring is a little tricky to get at, but otherwise all the mechanics of this thing are pretty great once you read the manual. Having read a bunch of other reviews before buying this, I really feel that many folks are skipping the reading part.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lenhart

customer_reviews.title: is well made
customer_reviews.text: does a good job when used and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Theron Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly designed as the wire can jump off the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly designed as the wire can jump off the pulley and get jammed into the sheave block. This should never happen: the wire should always be large enough and the pulley snug in the block so the wire cannot get jammed.
customer_reviews.author: Will Sentry

customer_reviews.title: It is a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use it for first time today. The cable is wound so tight that it won't pull out. I am screwed because I cannot return it for a refund or replacement because I waited too long to use the damn thing. It is a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have a very heavy Scag ridiing mower that I use to mow various places on a 30 plus acre property that has wet areas. I get stuck from time to time with no easy way to get towed out. With this handy and dependable tool, all I need is a tree and a long rope to attach and I am out in a few minutes. A great but inexpensive investment.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Appelbaum

product_meta.title: TEKTON 5541 2-Ton Power Puller
product_meta.description:
Size:2-TonWith a maximum rated capacity of 4,000 pounds and a safe working load of 2,000 pounds, the TEKTON 2 Ton Power Puller uses a ratcheting gear pulley system to pull heavy loads with one handed operation. It is ideal for use in construction, landscaping, and farm projects. 3/8 in. safety latch hooks are self-closing for secure use. Durable and strong 3/16 in. aircraft-grade braided steel cable has a maximum pull length of 7 ft. 10 in. Release the pawl for automatic, notch-at-a-time slow and safe tension letdown. The hardened one piece frame all-steel construction with a corrosion-resistant galvanized finish is built to last. For added durability, the steel gear and locking pawl are laminated. The high-leverage, 17 in. steel ratchet handle with cushioned nonslip grip is comfortable to use.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Powerful Ratcheting System Pulls Heavy Loads with Less Effort, Use for Construction, Landscaping, Loading/Unloading, and Farm Applications, Hardened All-Steel Construction with Corrosion-Resistant Galvanized Finish, Laminated Steel Gear and Locking Pawl, High-Tensile-Strength Aircraft-Grade Braided Steel Cable, Drop Forged Self-Closing Safety Catch Hooks , High-Leverage Ratchet Handle with Cushioned Non-Slip Grip , Automatic Notch-at-a-Time Letdown Controls Heavy Loads During Descent.
